register.description: This register enables the domain power state transition. It controls the HW supervised domain power state transition between ON-ACTIVE and ON-INACTIVE states. It also holds one status bit per clock input of the domain.

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the USB_OTG_SS_REF_CLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going
Corresponding clock is definitely gated

bitfield.description: This field indicates the state of the UTMI_P3_GFCLK clock in the domain. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going
Corresponding clock is definitely gated

bitenum.description: Corresponding clock is definitely gated

Corresponding clock is running or gating/ungating transition is on-going

bitfield.description: Controls the clock state transition of the L3INIT clock domain.

bitenum.description: NO_SLEEP: Sleep transition cannot be initiated. Wakeup transition may however occur.
SW_SLEEP: Start a software forced sleep transition on the domain.
SW_WKUP: Start a software forced wake-up transition on the domain.
HW_AUTO: Automatic transition is enabled. Sleep and wakeup transition are based upon hardware conditions.

register.description: This register controls the static domain dependencies from L3INIT domain towards 'target' domains. It is relevant only for domain having system initiator(s).

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards WKUPAON clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards L4SEC clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards L4_PER clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards L4_CFG clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards L3_MAIN2 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards L3_MAIN1 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards EMIF clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards ABE clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

bitfield.description: Static dependency towards IVA clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled
Dependency is enabled

register.description: This register controls the dynamic domain depedencies from L3INIT domain towards 'target' domains. It is relevant only for domain having INTRCONN master port(s).

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards L3_MAIN2 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled

bitfield.description: Dynamic dependency towards L3_MAIN1 clock domain

bitenum.description: Dependency is disabled

register.description: This register manages the MMC1 clocks.

bitfield.description: MMC1 clock divide ratio

bitenum.description: MMC1 clock is divided by 1, to be used for OPP_NOM.
MMC1 clock is divided by 2

bitfield.description: Selects the source of the functional clock.

bitenum.description: 128MHz clock derived from DPLL_PER is selected
192MHz clock derived from DPLL_PER is selected

bitfield.description: Module standby status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is functional (not in standby)
Module is in standby

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including INTRCONN
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only INTRCONN part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Optional functional clock control.

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled
Optional functional clock is enabled

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by SW. Any INTRCONN access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

register.description: This register manages the MMC2 clocks.

bitfield.description: MMC2 clock divide ratio 0x0: MMC2 clock is divided by 1, to be used for OPP_NOM. 0x1: MMC2 clock is divided by 2
Selects the source of the functional clock.

bitenum.description: 128MHz clock derived from DPLL_PER is selected
192MHz clock derived from DPLL_PER is selected

bitfield.description: Module standby status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is functional (not in standby)
Module is in standby

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including INTRCONN
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only INTRCONN part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by SW. Any INTRCONN access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guaranted to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

register.description: This register manages the HSI clocks.

bitfield.description: Selects the functional clock source.

bitenum.description: HSI_FCLK is divide by 1 of 192MHz clock, to be used for OPP_NOM
HSI_FCLK is divide by 2 of 192MHz clock

bitfield.description: Module standby status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is functional (not in standby)
Module is in standby

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including INTRCONN
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only INTRCONN part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.Read 0x: Reserved enum=RESERVED .

bitenum.description: Module is disable by SW. Any INTRCONN access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).
Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain

register.description: This register manages the USB_HOST_HS clocks.

bitfield.description: Selects the source of the functional clock for UTMI Port2 on USB_HOST_HS

bitenum.description: The functional clock is provided by the internal clock source
The functional clock is provided by an external PHY through an IO pad.

bitfield.description: Selects the source of the functional clock for UTMI Port1 on USB_HOST_HS

bitenum.description: The functional clock is provided by the internal clock source
The functional clock is provided by an external PHY through an IO pad.

bitfield.description: Module standby status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is functional (not in standby)
Module is in standby

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including Interconnect
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only Interconnect part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: USB_HOST_HS optional clock control: FUNC_48M_CLK

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled
Optional functional clock is enabled

bitfield.description: USB_HOST_HS optional clock control: HSIC_P2_480M_GFCLK

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled
Optional functional clock is enabled

bitfield.description: USB_HOST_HS optional clock control: HSIC_P1_480M_GFCLK

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled
Optional functional clock is enabled

bitfield.description: USB_HOST_HS optional clock control: HSIC_P2_GFCLK

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled
Optional functional clock is enabled

bitfield.description: USB_HOST_HS optional clock control: HSIC_P1_GFCLK

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled
Optional functional clock is enabled

bitfield.description: USB_HOST_HS optional clock control: UTMI_P3_GCLK

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled
Optional functional clock is enabled

bitfield.description: USB_HOST_HS optional clock control: UTMI_P2_GCLK when CLKSEL_UTMI_P2 is 0

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled
Optional functional clock is enabled

bitfield.description: USB_HOST_HS optional clock control: UTMI_P1_GCLK when CLKSEL_UTMI_P1 is 0

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled
Optional functional clock is enabled

bitfield.description: USB_HOST_HS optional clock control: HSIC_P3_480_GFCLK 0x0: Optional functional clock is disabled 0x1: Optional functional clock is enabled
USB_HOST_HS optional clock control: HSIC_P3_GFCLK 0x0: Optional functional clock is disabled 0x1: Optional functional clock is enabled
SAR mode control for the module. Shall not be modify except if module is disabled.

bitenum.description: SAR mode is disabled
SAR mode is enabled

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by SW. Any Interconnect access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

register.description: This register manages the USB_TLL_HS clocks.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including INTRCONN
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only INTRCONN part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: USB_TLL_HS optional clock control: USB_CH2_CLK (TLL_CH2_GFCLK)

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled
Optional functional clock is enabled

bitfield.description: USB_TLL_HS optional clock control: USB_CH1_CLK (TLL_CH1_GFCLK)

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled
Optional functional clock is enabled

bitfield.description: USB_TLL_HS optional clock control: USB_CH0_CLK (TLL_CH0_GFCLK)

bitenum.description: Optional functional clock is disabled
Optional functional clock is enabled

bitfield.description: SAR mode control for the module. Shall not be modify except if module is disabled.

bitenum.description: SAR mode is disabled
SAR mode is enabled

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by SW. Any Interconnect access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If[1:0] CLKTRCTRL = 0x3 (HW_AUTO), any Interconnect access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

register.description: This register manages the IEEE1500_2_OCP clocks.

bitfield.description: Module standby status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is functional (not in standby)
Module is in standby

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including Interconnect
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only Interconnect part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by SW. Any Interconnect access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

bitfield.description: SATA optional clock control: REF_CLK (from SYS_CLK clock) 0x0: Optional functional clock is disabled 0x1: Optional functional clock is enabled
Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by SW. Any Interconnect access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is explicitly enabled. Interface clock (if not used for functions) may be gated according to the clock domain state. Functional clocks are guarantied to stay present. As long as in this configuration, power domain sleep transition cannot happen.

register.description: This register manages the OCP2SCP1 clocks and the optional clock of USB_PHY_CORE.

bitfield.description: Module idle status. [warm reset insensitive]

bitenum.description: Module is fully functional, including Interconnect
Module is performing transition: wakeup, or sleep, or sleep abortion
Module is in Idle mode (only Interconnect part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by SW. Any Interconnect access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If[1:0] CLKTRCTRL = 0x3 (HW_AUTO), any Interconnect access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

Module is in Idle mode (only Interconnect part). It is functional if using separate functional clock
Module is disabled and cannot be accessed

bitfield.description: Control the way mandatory clocks are managed.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by SW. Any Interconnect access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If[1:0] CLKTRCTRL = 0x3 (HW_AUTO), any Interconnect access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.

bitenum.description: Module is disable by SW. Any Interconnect access to module results in an error, except if resulting from a module wakeup (asynchronous wakeup).

Module is managed automatically by HW according to clock domain transition. A clock domain sleep transition put module into idle. A wakeup domain transition put it back into function. If[1:0] CLKTRCTRL = 0x3 (HW_AUTO), any Interconnect access to module is always granted. Module clocks may be gated according to the clock domain state.
